Hi Emyr,

Sounds like an interesting project; I haven't heard of someone doing 
stock predicition with NEAT before.  What kind of data are you 
thinking of using for input? 

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "ej_1973" <e.j@v...> wrote:
> I just joined the group. I guess I'd better introduce myself...
> I have a degree in Physics from Cardiff (UK), did 3 years 
> Postgraduate research into the computer simulation of Polymers 
where 
> I started to become interested in Genetic Algorithms applied to 
the 
> protein folding problem. Since then I been working for a company 
> providing end-to-end online betting systems for the major 
> bookmakers, but have continued to be intrested in AI techniques in 
> my spare time. I started to get into using GA's to evolve neural 
> nets after reading Fogel's Blondie24. My current pet project is 
> trying to use those techniques to evolve a neural net to score 
stock 
> graphs based on wether it thinks they are a buy, hold or sell. I 
> started off with a very naieve GA and a fixed arbitrary net 
> topology. I stumbled onto NEAT whilst doing some google searches 
and 
> am now hoping to apply it to my get rich quick scheme :-) Feel 
free 
> to contact me if you would like to discuss anything.
> Emyr
